newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - NAB has most manufacturers - survey.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - NAB has most manufacturers - survey.

text.p: A survey of Australian manufacturers has found that National Australia Bank Ltd had the most manufacturer clients of any of the big four Australian banks.

But the survey by the Australian Chamber of Manufactures (ACM) also found that Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ) had most exporters and that manfacturers ranked the Commonwealth Bank of Australia highest in terms of overall services provided.

"The NAB was the most frequently used bank amongst manufacturers with around 28 percent, followed by Westpac Banking Corp on 23.2 percent, the ANZ Bank on 22.8 percent and the Commonwealth Bank on 15.3 percent," the ACM said.
"For exporters, the ANZ bank came out on top with 29 percent of manufacturers using the bank," it said.
"The ANZ also ranked the highest amongst exporters in terms of overall services provided," the ACM said.

Of the four main banks, the Commonwealth ranked the highest in terms of overall services with a score of 66 out of 100, followed by the National Australia Bank on 63.9, the ANZ Bank on 63.9 and Westpac on 58.2, the ACM said.
The ACM said the Commonwealth Bank also rated the highest nationally in terms of the ability of manufacturers to obtain funds, adequate overdraft facilities and useful information and advice.
